concept.definition: A type of database that includes non-SQL data stores. Examples include key-value stores, graph stores and document stores.
concept.note: NoSQL is not a product, a single pattern or an exclusive club. NoSQL is not only about horizontally scalable architectures. NoSQL is not only about clever use of caching, RAM or SSD.
concept.history-note: The term became popular around 2009 with a series of Meetups for people that were not using RDBSM.
concept.dct:creator: dmccreary
